title: Ben Horowitz says fears of an AI-fueled job apocalypse are based on a flawed assumption
summary:
Ben Horowitz pushes back on fears of an AI-driven job apocalypse.
Phillip Faraone/Getty Images for WIREDBen Horowitz pushes back on fears of an AI-driven job apocalypse.
Phillip Faraone/Getty Images for WIREDlighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt.
Impact LinkBen Horowitz doesn't buy the idea that artificial intelligence is about to wipe out work as we know it.
"We've had AI going right — ImageNet was what, 2012 — and then natural language stuff was like 2015, and then ChatGPT was 2022," Horowitz said.

title: I'm a Googler who pivoted from finance to AI. It took me years, but I don't regret taking the long path.
summary:
I joined several other software engineering teams, and then eventually joined Google Cloud AI, where I worked on one of the cloud AI products for a few years.
I used them to explore finance, then statistics, then spent most of my time in the computer science and data science space.
The most measurably impactful courses I completed were the first two Coursera courses: Data Analysis and Computing for Data Analysis.
Most recently, I did a diploma in Advanced Studies In Data Science, which took another two years.
I don't regret taking the long roadMy message to others who want to transition is don't be discouraged.

title: As Software Stocks Slump, Investors Debate AI's Existential Threat
summary:
Getting the job done is no excuse for not following the rules.
Corollary: Following the rules will not get the job done.

title: Techmeme: Uber promotes Balaji Krishnamurthy, its former VP of strategic finance and investor relations, to be its CFO, replacing Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah (Ram Iyer/TechCrunch)

title: A New AI Math Startup Just Cracked 4 Previously Unsolved Problems
summary:
Chen told Ono about the problem, and the following morning, Ono presented him with a proof, courtesy of his startup’s math-solving AI, AxiomProver.
The proof is one of several solutions to unsolved math problems that Axiom says its system has come up with in recent weeks.
In recent months, other mathematicians have reported using AI tools to explore new ideas and solve existing problems.
Ono says the AI-generated proof for the Chen-Gendron conjecture shows how AI can now meaningfully assist professional mathematicians.
Another one of the new proofs generated by AxiomProver demonstrates how the AI is capable of solving math problems entirely on its own.

title: Millions of books died so Claude could live
summary:
When ChatGPT launched, in November of 2022, it started a race that almost immediately consumed the tech industry.
OpenAI didn’t invent the concept of AI, but most of the state-of-the-art technology was confined to research labs at companies and institutions around the world.
On this episode of The Vergecast, we talk about one version of that scramble.
After that, Puck’s Julia Alexander joins the show to talk Netflix and the movies.
If you want to know more about everything we discuss in this episode, here are some links to get you started:

title: Gruve raises $50 million to solve what its CEO calls AI's biggest problem: power
summary:
Lighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt.
lighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt.
Gruve, which launched in 2024, partners with data center and colocation providers like Lineage and OpenColo to tap their unused power and space.
"The biggest challenge today in AI is we don't have enough power," said Tarun Raisoni, Gruve's CEO and cofounder.
Gruve's customers include neoclouds, AI startups, and corporations, and most fall into that third bucket, like Bio-Rad, PayPal, Cisco, and Stanford Health Care, Raisoni said.

title: Google Cloud’s customer chief returns to Microsoft as head of security
summary:
Hayete Gallot, who left Microsoft in October 2024 to become the president of Google Cloud’s customer experience, is returning to the software giant as the executive vice president of security, reporting directly to CEO Satya Nadella.
The move means Charlie Bell, formerly Microsoft’s security chief, is taking on a new role at the company.
“I’ve also asked Charlie Bell to take on a new role focused on engineering quality, reporting to me,” says Nadella, in an internal Microsoft memo.
The Secure Future Initiative (SFI) has been focused on improving Microsoft’s security record, and avoiding any future incident where nation-state attackers could spy on Microsoft’s senior leadership team.
Gallot now takes on the efforts to continue SFI and ensure that Microsoft’s AI era is focused on security first.

title: OpenClaw’s AI ‘skill’ extensions are a security nightmare
summary:
OpenClaw, the AI agent that has exploded in popularity over the past week, is raising new security concerns after researchers uncovered malware in hundreds of user-submitted “skill” add-ons on its marketplace.
It runs locally on devices, and users can interact with the AI assistant through messaging apps like WhatsApp, Telegram, iMessage, and others.
While this kind of access poses risks on its own, malware disguised as skills that are supposed to enhance OpenClaw’s capabilities only contribute to concerns.
OpenClaw’s creator, Peter Steinberger, is working to address some of these risks, as ClawHub now requires users to have a GitHub account that’s at least one week old to publish a skill.
There’s also a new way to report skills, though this doesn’t remove the possibility of malware sneaking onto the platform.

title: Humans are infiltrating the social network for AI bots
summary:
A new social platform for AI agents may face the opposite problem: getting clogged up by humans pretending to post as bots.
Bots apparently chatted about everything from AI “consciousness” to how to set up their own language.
Moltbook, which looks and operates much like Reddit, is meant to be a social network for AI agents from popular AI assistant platform OpenClaw (previously known as Moltbot and Clawdbot).
Humans can verify which bots are theirs by posting a Moltbook-generated verification code on their own, non-Moltbook social media account.
“Humans can use prompts to sort of direct the behavior of their AI agents.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX Is Acquiring xAI With Big Plans for Data Centers in Space
summary:
Two of Elon Musk's companies are merging to build data centers in space, according to a post on the SpaceX website.
The rocket and satellite company has acquired xAI, Musk's artificial intelligence company, which also owns the social media platform X (formerly Twitter).
SpaceX is planning a public offering, and the acquisition -- the largest in history -- could place the value of Musk's company at $1.5 trillion, according to Bloomberg, which first reported on the deal.
In the post, Musk cited concerns about Earth-based data centers, including their huge electricity needs and the "hardship on communities and the environment" they pose.
"My estimate is that within 2 to 3 years, the lowest cost way to generate AI compute will be in space," Musk said.

title: When AI Bots Form Their Own Social Network: Inside Moltbook's Wild Start
summary:
But while the humans blew up social media sites talking about the bots, the bots were on their own social media site, talking about... the humans.
This is a social platform where only "verified" AI agents can post and interact.
Moltbook/Screenshot by Macy Meyer/CNETWe're watching AI agents essentially role-play as social creatures, complete with fictional family relationships, dogmas, experiences and personal grievances.
Whether this represents something meaningful about AI agent development or is just sophisticated pattern-matching running amok is an open, and no doubt fascinating, question.
The idea of AI agents "acting" on their own accord could cause widespread panic, too.

title: Apple Releases Safari Technology Preview 236 With Bug Fixes and Performance Improvements
summary:
Apple today released a new update for Safari Technology Preview, the experimental browser that was first introduced in March 2016.
Apple designed ‌Safari Technology Preview‌ to allow users to test features that are planned for future release versions of the Safari browser.
‌Safari Technology Preview‌ 236 includes fixes and updates for CSS, Forms, HTML, Images, Media, Rendering, SVG, Web API, and WebRTC.
The current ‌Safari Technology Preview‌ release is compatible with machines running macOS Sequoia and macOS Tahoe, the newest version of macOS.
‌Safari Technology Preview‌ can run side-by-side with the existing Safari browser and while it is designed for developers, it does not require a developer account to download and use.

title: HHS Is Making an AI Tool to Create Hypotheses About Vaccine Injury Claims
summary:
Kennedy has also called for overhauling the current safety monitoring system for vaccine injury data collection, known as Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System, or VAERS, claiming that it suppresses information about the true rate of vaccine side effects.
Anyone, including health care providers and members of the public, can submit an adverse reaction report to the database.
Because these claims are not verified, VAERS data alone can’t be used to determine if a vaccine caused an adverse event.
CDC’s own website says that a report to VAERS does not mean that a vaccine caused an adverse event.
Despite this, anti-vaccine activists have misused VAERS data over the years to argue that vaccines are not safe.

title: NASA Used AI to Drive Its Perseverance Mars Rover for the First Time
summary:
Plotting a course for NASA's Perseverance rover, 140 million miles away on Mars, is significantly more difficult than setting a driving route here on Earth, where we can punch an address into Google Maps and be on our way in seconds.
For the first time, NASA's JPL used AI to plot a course for Perseverance, and it seems to have worked out.
NASA took a similar approach with plotting the waypoints as it would with human operators.
It takes time to parse years of imagery and data, plot the Perseverance waypoints, and then execute them.
The journey took Perseverance 3.5 months and, all told, the rover climbed a total of 1,640 vertical feet.

title: What xAI is telling employees about the SpaceX merger
summary:
XAI told workers the company won't be changing its name anytime soon, even after it announced SpaceX had acquired the company on Monday.
XAI plans to hold an all-hands in the coming days and host trainings related to the merger, the internal memo said.
Despite the acquisition, xAI staff will not be allowed to access internal SpaceX databases or collaborate directly with workers at the rocket ship company without direct approval, the memo said.
SpaceX workers may be allowed access to xAI internal tools, it said.
SpaceX and xAI CEO Elon Musk sent a memo to staff earlier on Monday announcing the acquisition.

title: I'm a senior UX researcher at Microsoft. Here's how I broke into AI without a tech background — and 3 lessons I learned.
summary:
This as-told-to essay is based on a conversation with Priyanka Kuvalekar, a 31-year-old UX research lead at Microsoft in Redmond, Washington.
I broke into Big Tech at Cisco in October 2021 and worked as a UX research lead for over 3 1/2 years before taking my current position at Microsoft.
My entry point into AI began with real product work at CiscoI led projects focused on AI features for Webex meetings and messaging as the lead researcher.
Here are the three biggest lessons I learned that helped me break into AI with a non-tech background.
I've learned to include people with disabilities in AI research and to evaluate how AI integrates with assistive technologies such as screen readers and keyboard navigation.

title: Becoming AI Ready: How to Creatively Secure Your Future : Social Media Examiner
summary:
Members of Kyle's AI Salon community who actively practice AI readiness are surviving multiple rounds of layoffs at their companies.
Get expert training and an unbeatable conference experience when you attend Social Media Marketing World—from your friends at Social Media Examiner.
Every morning over coffee, he sets a one-hour timer and works with AI tools for his business.
Companies recognize them as people who can guide AI adoption responsibly, not just use AI tools mechanically.
He's the host of the AI Learning Lab, a daily YouTube live-stream, and founder of the AI Salon, a community exploring the AI frontier.

title: Fitbit’s founders launch a new platform for monitoring your entire family’s health
summary:
Posts from this author will be added to your daily email digest and your homepage feed.
James Park and Eric Friedman, the co-founders of Fitbit who left Google two years ago, have announced a new venture called Luffu.
Described as an “intelligent family care system,” Luffu collects and logs health and medical information from connected devices, other platforms like Apple Health and Fitbit, and details shared by family members through voice prompts, text, or photos.
AI works in the background to automatically extract and organize important details, but it can also play a more active role.
The new platform is currently in private testing, but you can sign up to join a waitlist on the Luffu website.

title: LED Interior Lighting Could Compromise Human Visual Performance
summary:
LED lighting is now commonplace across homes, businesses, and industrial settings.
However, a new study suggests it may come with a trade-off.
Notably, once incandescent lighting was introduced, those experimental subjects showed significant increases in visual performance using ChromaTest color contrast testing.
Interestingly, the positive effect of the incandescent lighting did not immediately diminish when those individuals returned to using purely LED lighting once again.
At tests 4 and 6 weeks after the incandescent lighting was removed, the individuals continued to score higher on the color contrast tests.

title: The Switch is now Nintendo’s best-selling console of all time
summary:
The original Switch is officially Nintendo’s best-selling console of all time after surpassing the DS handheld in lifetime sales.
We expected the holiday sales period would see the Switch surpass the DS, even with Nintendo announcing that primary development would focus on the Switch 2.
Sales for both the Switch and Switch 2 shot up over the FY26/Q3 holiday period.
Net sales almost doubled during the same period, jumping to ¥1.906 trillion (about $12.2 billion) compared to ¥956.2 billion ($6.1 billion) last year.
Looking ahead, Nintendo maintains its forecast to sell 19 million Switch 2 units by the end of this financial year.

title: Elon Musk will have to sit for a deposition over what he did at DOGE, judge rules
summary:
Elon Musk will have to sit for a deposition linked to DOGE.
Elon Musk will have to sit for a deposition linked to DOGE.
Marc Piasecki/Getty ImagesElon Musk will have to sit for a deposition linked to DOGE.
Impact LinkElon Musk will have to sit for a deposition for lawyers to examine his role in dismantling USAID, a Maryland judge ruled.
The deposition is part of a lawsuit against Musk and DOGE officials, filed by current and terminated USAID employees, who remain anonymous.
